column2: Rulers who serve the same demon lord can freely subjugate each other in order to prove themselves the most worthy of their Master's attention.
Rulers sworn to different Lords of the Abyss can seek to humiliate each other to prove the superiority of their Master.
Sacrifice [Root.GetBestName] to their abyssal patron in order to prove your devotion.
was offered up in sacrifice to a Demon Lord

The wicked Abyss-pawn [FROMFROM.GetTitledName] has sacrificed [From.GetTitledName] to their demon gods! After bringing [From.GetHerHim] to a bloodied altar, [FROMFROM.GetHerHis] wicked priests placed [From.GetFirstName] on an altar and sliced [From.GetHerHim] open with a ceremonial dagger. They then consigned [From.GetHerHis] soul to their damned patron in the Abyss.
It seems that [From.GetTitledName] has not only gotten [From.GetHerHim]self captured, but also sacrificed by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] in order to propitiate some demonic lord.

You lead the whimpering [FROM.GetTitledName] to the sacrificial altar, to be a sacrfice to your Demon Lord. Once you strap [From.GetHerHim] to the altar, one of your priests walks forward with a ceremonial dagger and slits [From.GetTitledName]'s throat, dooming [From.GetHerHis] to the Abyss.
Have your forces make their way across this province

You give the order, all who inhabit [From.GetName] must bow down to the might of your abyssal patron or die! Your forces now make their way across the region, putting to the sword all those who do not comply.
They shall bow to their true master soon.

The Lantanna organize their leadership into a council named the Ayrorch which is led by an Ayrar and composed of other eleven members known as Santar who, upon the death of the Ayrar, elect a new Governmentr.
The Santar are responsible for picking a new Governmentr for the nation of Lantan.
Among the Rashemi, the witches of the Wychlaran are the supreme arbiters of who gets to Government and only men are able to be elected to such positions.
Resembling humans with more delicate features, spirit folk are the mystical descendants of humans and nature spirits and thus more attuned to the natural world itself.

The devils of Baator have a great interest in corrupting and conquering the Prime Material Plane both for the souls they can harvest from it as well as a new staging area in the Blood War. To that end, they offer great power to mortals willing to serve their cause.

Fiends are evil outsiders and as such their forms of organization are often alien to the inhabitants of Toril. When they invade, they often rally behind a strong leader and care little as to what kind of mortal settlements they conquer as long as they are able to do so.

Illithids, or Mind Flayers, are aberrations of seemingly unknown origin. They possess incredible psionic powers, which they use to enslave most creatures who cross their path. Physically, they resemble a human with an octopus-like head.
The Lotus Emperor of Yikaria is also the high priest of the Faceless God and is doomed to be sacrificed after exactly 20 years of service.

The Yakfolk of Yikaria are Governmentd by a theocratic priest-emperor empowered by the Faceless God himself. The Lotus Emperor forsakes his own name and after twenty years of Government becomes himself a sacrifice to the Faceless God.
Use your powers, be they magic of psionic, to ensure total loyalty.

Moander was an ancient deity of rot, corruption and decay. The Darkbringer has never had a large following, but was worshipped since before the rise of Netheril. Moander was also notable for appearing with varying genders in their many appearances. Moander was a cruel and controlling tyrant, relishing in tormenting and destroying mortals.

After a long time of hard work you can now claim that you've reached a new level in your chosen path.
To succeed in this ambition, you must gain a level in this class.
Subject the prisoner to ceremorphosis in order to create a new mind flayer of your dynasty.
You hear the door of your cell being opened, and through it steps [From.GetBestName]. In [From.GetHerHis] hands is some strange sort of tadpole, and even looking at it causes you great discomfort.
The ceremorphosis process has failed on [From.GetBestName].

Adopting Magocratic Government will convert all my Tribal Holdings into Castles. Where this occurs - if the County is big enough - City and Temple Holdings will also be created if they do not already exist. Your vassals are likely to follow suit if they are of your religion and culture.

Adopting Magocratic Government will convert all my Tribal Holdings into Castles. Where this occurs - if the County is big enough - City and Temple Holdings will also be created if they do not already exist. Your vassals are likely to follow suit if they are of your religion and culture.

Adopting Oligarchic Government will convert all my Tribal Holdings into Cities. Where this occurs - if the County is big enough - Castle and Temple Holdings will also be created if they do not already exist. Your vassals are likely to follow suit if they are of your religion and culture.

Must be a religious enemy of the target
This area is partially phased into the Feywild, and thus possesses many attributes of the Faerie Realm.
Illithids, or mind flayers, have their own special mechanics that affect how they play significantly. These mechanics are ceremorphosis and mind control. Which would you like to learn about?

Ceremorphosis is a targeted decision that allows you to create a new heir from a prisoner. The prisoner must be a human, half-human, elf, orc or goblinoid of less than 70 years of age (unless they are an elf or gith). This has a chance of failure and costs piety (scaling with how many heirs you have).

Mind control is a decision that can target any of your vassals or courtiers as long as they are not illithids or yikarians. It costs both piety and prestige, but makes the target utterly loyal to you for 10 years.
Wizards have unique mechanics that you may want to know about. These mechanics control how they cast and acquire their spells. What would you like to learn about?

In order to access spells other than the universal ones you must choose a school of magic to specialize in. Each, except Wild Magic, has opposed schools whose spells you can't learn and will give you a set of spells of that school. Wild Magic will instead grant you a single unique spell plus a few spells from other schools.

To cast a spell, you must expend spell points, which are displayed in a modifier on your character. Spell points are determined based on your learning and wizard level. These refresh, and are recalculated, once a year.

In order to get new spells, you must research them via a decision that costs gold (scaled on your income). You are guaranteed to learn one new spell, though the time it takes may vary. You can't learn spells from opposing schools.
Some realms and religions have a dim view on arcane magic and may seek to regulate or even outlaw its use. In realms where it is outlawed, arcane casters can even be imprisoned by the local rulers.
Whenever a wild mage casts any spell, there is a chance that the spell will go haywire in a wild surge, which can cause a host of different effects, some novel, some potentially lethal.
Tutorial events will fire for you when starting the game or accessing new mechanics.
Choose a school of magic to specialize in.
All wizards must choose a school of magic to which they devote themselves.
was banished back to the Planes
died in a wild magic surge
Minor story events will fire if their conditions are met
Minor story events will never happen
Because this mod has a growing number of custom mechanics, there is a tutorial decision that lets you see explanations of them.
This will open an event listing all tutorials for you to peruse.
Please select what tutorial you want to see.

Holy Wars in Faerun work differently than in the base game. A character can declare a holy war on others based on their religion and/or patron trait. This means that sometimes you can even declare a holy war on someone of your own religion.\n\nWho you can war against is detailed in either the patron trait or religion description.
